decks.notes: This Naya Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures combined with spells that target them, triggering abilities and protecting them. The key strategy is to play low-cost creatures like Tenth District Legionnaire and Dreadhorde Arcanist, then use spells like Defiant Strike and Gods Willing to pump them up and protect them. Season of Growth helps to draw more cards and maintain hand advantage. Feather, the Redeemed allows for spell recursion, while Domri's Ambush and Reckless Rage provide removal options. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats while maintaining card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the graveyard and legendary creatures to create a powerful combo, supported by cards like Kethis and Diligent Excavator. Lazav can copy key creatures in the graveyard, while Mox Amber and Teferi help with mana acceleration and control. Oath of Kaya and Ashiok provide disruption and removal, while Tamiyo helps with card advantage and recursion. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence and powerful synergies.

The focus of this deck is to create a powerful combo using Lazav, the Multifarious, Kethis, the Hidden Hand, and Diligent Excavator to mill through the library and win the game with Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The deck utilizes various legendary creatures and planeswalkers to support the combo and control the board, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Ashiok, Dream Render and Urza's Ruinous Blast. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to outmaneuver the opponent and secure a victory.

The focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to swarm the board with efficient green creatures and utilize removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also aims to generate additional value with planeswalkers such as Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. With powerful threats like Steel Leaf Champion and Voracious Hydra, along with mana acceleration from Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize Lazav's ability to copy creatures in the graveyard combined with Kethis' ability to cast historic spells from the graveyard. By combining these abilities with cards like Diligent Excavator and Mox Amber, the deck aims to quickly mill through the library and assemble a combo win condition. Cards like Tamiyo, Teferi, and Urza's Ruinous Blast provide disruption and protection while Ashiok helps prevent opponents from accessing their graveyard. The deck aims to control the board and win through a powerful combo finish.

The deck revolves around utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly assemble key combo pieces, such as Kethis, the Hidden Hand, Diligent Excavator, and Lazav, the Multifarious, to generate powerful synergies and overwhelming board presence. Supporting cards like Tamiyo, Collector of Tales and Teferi, Time Raveler help protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By efficiently utilizing the graveyard and leveraging powerful legendary creatures, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace opponents to achieve a dominating position on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with low-cost vampire creatures and utilizing cards like Legion's Landing and Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord to create tokens and support their aggressive strategy. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of creatures and pump effects like Sanctum Seeker to drain their life total before they can stabilize. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Legion's End and removal like Cast Down and Mortify help to clear the way for efficient attacks.

This Orzhov Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive creature-based strategy. By utilizing powerful tribal synergies with vampires and efficient low-cost creatures, the deck can quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord and Vona, Butcher of Magan provide additional utility and resilience to the deck, allowing it to maintain momentum and close out games quickly. With a mix of evasion, removal, and powerful threats, this deck is built to dominate the early game and secure victory before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with a focus on the Orzhov color combination. It utilizes a mix of low-cost creatures and powerful synergies to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Key cards like Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord and Legion Lieutenant help boost creature power while providing additional utility. The deck also includes removal spells like Cast Down and Legion's End to handle threats from the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to establish early board presence and maintain pressure throughout the game to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with cheap and efficient creatures like Merfolk Trickster and Siren Stormtamer, then protect them with spells like Dive Down and Spell Pierce. By using Curious Obsession to draw extra cards and maintain card advantage, alongside counterspells like Wizard's Retort and Lookout's Dispersal, the Mono Blue Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with flying threats like Tempest Djinn and finish them off quickly.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures such as Adanto Vanguard, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Legion Lieutenant to overwhelm opponents early in the game. Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord provides additional creature support and synergy, while Legion's Landing helps generate tokens for more pressure. Mortify and Legion's End offer removal options to clear the way for attacks. The deck aims to chip away at the opponent's life total efficiently and maintain a strong board presence to secure victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature-based strategies, aiming to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures like Adanto Vanguard, Feather, and Tenth District Legionnaire. The deck also includes spells like Defiant Strike, Gods Willing, and Reckless Rage to protect and boost its creatures. The addition of Aurelia, Legion Warboss, and Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants provides additional power and synergy to the deck. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of Plains, Mountains, and dual lands like Clifftop Retreat and Sacred Foundry.

This Red Deck Wins archetype focuses on playing fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck includes low-cost creatures like Fanatical Firebrand and Ghitu Lavarunner, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock. Runaway Steam-Kin helps ramp up mana quickly, while Experimental Frenzy provides card advantage and allows for continuous casting of spells. The goal of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a stream of fast damage and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and gaining incremental advantage with cards like Hero of Precinct One and Elite Guardmage. Using a mix of versatile removal and counter magic, combined with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, Esper Control aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent until it can establish a decisive advantage and secure victory.

This deck focuses on building a board presence quickly with efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Risen Reef, while utilizing powerful Planeswalkers like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game and generate value. Deputy of Detention and Trostani Discordant provide additional removal and resilience against removal spells, while Hydroid Krasis and Finale of Glory offer late-game finishing power. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent playability. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and versatile threats.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers and removal spells to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With cards like Nicol Bolas, the Ravager and Nicol Bolas, Dragon-God providing card advantage and versatile abilities, along with removal spells like Bedevil and Ritual of Soot to handle threats, the deck aims to slow down the game and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Thought Erasure helps to disrupt the opponent's hand and restrict their options, while maintaining a consistent mana base for casting powerful spells.
